intro: Cynoglossum virginianum, commonly known as Virginia ironweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist to wet habitats such as swamps and stream banks. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinators.
